definition[0]: a tame animal or bird is not wild any longer, because it has been trained to live with people
example[1]: Most of the criticism has been pretty tame.
example[2]: I decided that teaching was too tame for me.
definition[2]: used to describe a person who is willing to do what other people ask, even if it is slightly dishonest
example[3]: If you have a tame doctor, he might give you a sick note.
definition[3]: to reduce the power or strength of something and prevent it from causing trouble
example[4]: The prime minister managed to tame the trade unions.
definition[4]: to train a wild animal to obey you and not to attack people
example[5]: The Asian elephant can be tamed and trained.
